Package com.library.backend.services

Class EmailSenderService

java.lang.Object
com.library.backend.services.EmailSenderService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service
public class EmailSenderService extends Object implements Service
The EmailSenderService class provides functionality for sending emails using JavaMail API. It allows customization of the email configuration such as SMTP host, port, and SSL settings.

Example Usage: 

 
 // Create an EmailSenderService instance with email configuration
 EmailSenderService emailSender = new EmailSenderService("yourUsername", "yourPassword", "smtp.example.com", "587", true);

 // Send an email
 try {
     emailSender.sendEmail("recipient@example.com", "Subject", "Body");
     // Email sent successfully
 } catch (EmailException e) {
     // Handle the case where sending the email fails
 }
In this example, an EmailSenderService instance is created with the necessary email configuration, and the sendEmail method is used to send an email. If the email is sent successfully, the log will indicate success; otherwise, an EmailException is thrown with details about the failure.

The EmailSenderService class supports both standard SMTP and SMTP with SSL connections.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • EmailSenderService

      public EmailSenderService(String username, String password, String smtpHost, String smtpPort, boolean useSSL) throws TransportException
      Constructs an EmailSenderService instance with the specified email configuration.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for authentication.
      password - The password for authentication.
      smtpHost - The SMTP server host.
      smtpPort - The SMTP server port.
      useSSL - True if SSL should be used, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      TransportException - If there is an issue initializing the Transport object.

    • EmailSenderService

      public EmailSenderService(String username, String password, String smtpHost, String smtpPort, boolean useSSL, javax.mail.Transport transport)
      Constructs an EmailSenderService instance with the specified email configuration and pre-initialized transport.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for authentication.
      password - The password for authentication.
      smtpHost - The SMTP server host.
      smtpPort - The SMTP server port.
      useSSL - True if SSL should be used, false otherwise.
      transport - Pre-initialized Transport for sending emails.

  • Method Details

    • sendEmail

      public void sendEmail(String to, String subject, String body) throws EmailException
      Sends an email with the specified recipient, subject, and body.
      Parameters:
      to - The recipient's email address.
      subject - The subject of the email.
      body - The body/content of the email.
      Throws:
      EmailException - If there is an issue sending the email.
